intro: Escobariopsis lasiacantha subsp. magallanii, commonly known as the Magallanes escobariopsis, is a small, cushion-like plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
